value:
The dataset description information are composed of 4 categories:

  • The description of the people or organisations responsible for or related to the endpoint and the content of the dataset
  • The description of the license and other legal elements related to the endpoint and the content of the dataset
  • The description of the date of creation and last dates of modification of the content of the dataset
  • The description of elements relative to the generation of the content of the dataset
The description of those elements should be done using well-known vocabularies such as DCTerms and PROV-O.
Below, we give examples of dataset description triples corresponding to each category:
In this graph, only the vocabularies listed in Linked Open Vocabularies and prefix.cc are shown.
In this graph, all the vocabularies extracted by IndeGx are shown. IndeGx identify vocabularies as the namespaces of the classes and properties appearing in a dataset.
This graph shows the endpoints connected to the keyword used in Linked Open Vocabularies to describe their vocabularies

This graph shows the endpoints connected to the different vocabularies most often used to define other vocabularies, hence "meta-vocabularies". As all endpoint did return their list of vocabularies when interrogated by IndeGx, all endpoints are not represented.
